widget.name: File Dropper
widget.description: Drop files in your Mendix Application

property.caption: Name attribute
property.description: Attribute for name of the file, usually 'Name'

property.caption: Type attribute
property.description: Attribute for the filetype, it is not required, it can be used to filter data. Values are like 'image/jpeg' etc.

property.caption: Extension attribute
property.description: Attribute for the extension. Is is not required, but can be used to filter data. Values are like 'jpeg', 'png' etc. The widget will determine based on the fileType what the expected extension is. If unknown, it will set it to 'unknown'.

property.caption: Association to context
property.description: If provided used to set the association of new files to the context. Should be a path to the context.

property.caption: Auto save
property.description: Automatically save to Mendix. If you set this to 'false' you will have to press a manual button to save the file to Mendix.

property.caption: Save method
property.description: Determine how the data is uploaded. Using the saveDocument method is the easiest, where it will use the standard Mendix methods. This is the most stable. Downside: no progress, so the progress bar will be shown as 50% while uploading. You can also use the POST method, which would provide a progress bar.

property.caption: Max. file size
property.description: Maximum file size in MB

property.caption: Max. files
property.description: Maximum number of files to upload, if > 0

property.caption: Mime types
property.description:
Restrict the files to a certain type using Mime types. You can use a string like 'image/*,audio/*,video/*'.
Note 1: This might not always be accurate. There can be differences between platforms & browsers. To be sure it is better to use the 'onAccept Microflow' Note 2: When using an Entity that is/inherits 'System.Image', Mime types will always be ignored and set to 'image/*'. You can further restrict this using the 'onAccept Microflow'

property.caption: onAccept Mf
property.description:
Microflow that will be called to determine if a file is accepted. If not, it should return a false. The Dropzone will remove the file by itself. This microflow will use the entity defined in 'Data'.
Note: This microflow is executed AFTER the file is uploaded. When doing big uploads, it is better to maybe also add a verification before upload.

property.caption: Verification entity
property.description:
This entity is used to verify the file BEFORE it is uploaded to the server. The widget will create an object and add the defined attributes. After the 'beforeAccept Microflow/Nanoflow' returns an empty string value (this is the error message, empty when no error occurred), the file itself will be committed and uploaded.
Note 1: Only non-persistent entities are accepted, as the widget will create/delete the object itself. Note 2: For this non-persistent entity, when applying Entity Access, give everyone permissions to create/delete this object, and read/write access on any attributes. Note 3: To avoid any other problem, make sure this helper object is detached from any other objects. It should be standalone and have zero references to others.

property.caption: Name attr.
property.description: Attribute for the name of the file, usually 'Name'.

property.caption: Type attr.
property.description: Attribute for the filetype, it is not required, it can be used to filter data in the on accept microflow. Values are like 'image/jpeg'.

property.caption: Extension attr.
property.description: Attribute for the extension. Is is not required, but can be used to filter data. Values are like 'jpeg', 'png' etc. The widget will determine based on the fileType what the expected extension is. If unknown, it will set it to 'unknown'.

property.caption: Size attr.
property.description: Size of the file in bytes.

property.caption: Before Accept Mf
property.description: Microflow that will be called BEFORE the file is uploaded. It will pass an object defined as Verification entity. The microflow should return a String which serves as a reason NOT to accept the file. If the microflow returns an empty string (either empty or ''), it considers the file to be accepted.

property.caption: Before Accept Nf
property.description: Nanoflow that will be called BEFORE the file is uploaded. It will pass an object defined as Verification entity. The microflow should return a String which serves as a reason NOT to accept the file. If the microflow returns an empty string (either empty or ''), it considers the file to be accepted.

property.caption: Before commit microflow
property.description: Before committing any file, run this microflow. This can be used to verify the context object (needs to be committed before you can commit any file you associate with). It should return a boolean with True before it commits the files

property.caption: Before commit nanoflow
property.description: Before committing any file, run this nanoflow. This can be used to verify the context object (needs to be committed before you can commit any file you associate with). It should return a boolean with True before it commits the files

property.caption: After commit microflow
property.description: After the file is succesfully committed, this microflow can be executed

property.caption: After commit nanoflow
property.description: After the file is succesfully committed, this nanoflow can be executed

property.caption: Show preview
property.description: Show preview block on left side.

property.caption: Show type label
property.description: Show the type label in the previews

property.caption: Show image previews
property.description: Show previews of images. The widget will determine by itself, based on the Mime type, whether or not it can show a preview. It does this by analyzing the file and if it determines it is a 'image/*' file, show a base64 encoded version of the image.

property.caption: Hide progress bar on complete
property.description: When uploading to Mendix is complete, hide the progress bar

property.caption: Primary color
property.description: Default is '#2387AA'

property.caption: Trail color
property.description: Default is '#C8F5FF'

property.caption: Error color
property.description: Default is '#FF0000'

property.caption: Success color
property.description: Default is '#0A9B00'
